headline: Cherry Crisp
description: This cherry crisp is simple to make with canned pie filling topped with a crunchy oat, brown sugar, and pecan crumble for a quick, delicious dessert.
name: Cherry Crisp

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C.) Lightly grease a 2-quart baking dish.
Pour pie filling into the prepared baking dish; spread evenly.
Stir together brown sugar, flour, oats, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a medium bowl. Mix in melted margarine. Spread over pie filling and sprinkle with chopped pecans.
Bake in the preheated oven until topping is golden brown, about 30 minutes. Allow to cool 15 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: First of all, YUMMM! I moved in with my elderly father a week ago. We are doing hospice at home for him as his heart is failing. My husband has a birthday today and I wanted to make some thing for him. I scrounged around in my dad‘s kitchen and could not locate the ingredients necessary for a birthday cake. Therefore I made him, a cherry crisp! I dearly love this recipe.
Way to much nutmeg cut it back and would be amazing. Very good as it was though.
Made the recipe exactly as stated......Delicious with whipped topping. Fast.Easy and portion size perfect. A keeper for the recipe box, thank you for sharing.
Omit nuts.
Easy directions
Really good. Followed exactly the recipes. Will make again
Definitely do not melt the butter. Just break up into cold pea sized chunks. Used sour cherries so it wouldn't be too sweet. Pretty yummy stuff.

My family loved this. I added a 1/2 tsp almond extract, some lemon zest and a splash of triple sec to the cherry pie filling because it was bland. I reduced the nutmeg to 1/8 tsp based on other reviews and also reduced the brown sugar to 1/2 cup. The toasted pecans on top really made it so I'm glad I used them. I also used cold butter cut into the topping instead of melted margarine. This made a nice crispy topping. Very easy and very yummy!

Delicious flavor/texture!. Made it in an 8x8 pan(please specify standard pan size) and added 1/2 t of gran marnier to cherries. Made extra topping after reading other reviews but only used proportions in the recipe-it was enough for this size pan. Used half melted/half cubed butter in food processor-couple of pulses. Guess I’ll have to make it again to use the leftover topping! It’s a keeper-easy and delicious. I like that it doesn’t make a ton, so sneaky Pete, AKA my husband , won’t keep picking at it for days.
Very good and super easy.
Way too much nutmeg for my taste. I will try again with less nutmeg.

This dessert is like a bowl of cherries with a very satisfying cookie crust on top of it - yum! I wanted to use fresh sweet cherries instead of canned pie filling, and I wanted to cut some of the fat, so here's what I did, and it worked perfectly. 1) Pit and halve fresh sweet cherries until you have 3 cups. 2) Add 1 1/2 T cornstarch, 1/2 t vanilla extract, 1/4 t almond extract, and 1/4 cup sugar to the cherries and stir. 3) Follow the rest of the recipe as written, except drizzle 1/4 cup melted butter over the crisp part instead of 1/2 cup.
this is a simple, quick, easy and delicious recipe. We served it with some fresh, homemade whipped cream and loved it.
I was a wee bit more heavy-handed with the spices than the recipe suggested but I'm always like that with things that require cinnamon, allspice, etc.
Use less nutmeg and it will be perfect
This was great with vanilla ice cream. Made as written.
It was quite good considering I made it! I'm not much of a cook/baker. It was very sweet, might be too sweet for some. But we liked it.
So happy to find this recipe!! It HAS to be identical to what my mom made when I was at home!

Very good crisp! I doubled the recipe and did an apple filling and cherry filling side by side in a 9×13. When I make it again I will use less nutmeg. The nutmeg is too strong in bites that don't have vanilla ice cream in them. All in all pretty good though!
Easy to make just adjusted the nutmeg since someone else said it was too much
I followed the recipe to a tee and it was fantastic! Thank you!

This is a good crisp that’ll be awesome with peaches or any fruit. This is a keeper. 
I threw in some frozen whole unsweetened cherries along w the can of pie filling. Added a few extra dollups of butter to the top during the baking for that extra crunch.

It wasn’t crispy, but it was delicious!
I left out the nutmeg and added 1/2t of almond extract. It made enough for an 8x8 pan.
1/2 cup brown sugar instead. Vanilla extract instead of nutmeg. Butter cut up not margarine in baking
Delicious and easy. Reminds me of dump cake. I made mine gluten free with King Arthur’s gluten free flour. We put whipped cream on ours and it was best served warm.
Best thing in the world for whatever ails you! Lock-down 2020 relief! Have made this for ages. I increased the topping a bit since I love extra thick topping crunch.

A very easy recipe to put together at the last minute. We don't care for the nutmeg taste, and I think I would add about 1/4 tsp. of almond extract. Other than that, the recipe is fantastic for our family.

Looks good!
Taste good
Vanilla bean Ice cream or whip cream makes it soooooo good
Super simple and delish! Thanks for sharing.

I add a little white sugar and a little extra cinnamon and butter but this a fav of every bodies and so easy to make!! I have 7 grandkids and it is so easy I let everybody pick their favorite filling and we have “crisp” night!!! Totally awesome!!!
I made it just as the recipe was written. It was perfect. I do think I will make a larger quantity of the crisp next time since it was so delicious! One can never have enough of a good thing!
Yep, easy and pretty perfect. Added handful of fresh blueberries, and omitted nutmeg. Other than that I followed to a Tee. Served for company with cool whip. Great recipe!

This was ok, a little vanilla ice cream improved it considerably. . 
I usually try to try a recipe exactly as the it is printed so I have a baseline. 
I will make this again, but I will definitely use less sugar and look for a pie filling with more cherries less sugary gel. 
If you like teeth hurting sweet stuff this is the recipe for you. if you like more fruit flavor, cut the brown sugar by half.
Also good with black cherry filling. And if you add extra spices, its a nice balance with the sweetness.
It was yummy. Yes I will make it again

So delicious! I used cold butter in place of margarine. Cut the cold butter into pieces and mix with dry ingredients mashing it until blended. Also, I used less Nutmeg and a little more cinnamon. Then top the cherries with it and bake. Turns out beautiful.
Came out great, and it's a snap to throw together. Kids of all ages enjoyed it!
it was good but needed two cans pie filling there was nothing left as soon it cooled it was gone will make again
I've made this with cherry and blueberry pie filling. I left out the spices and both were delicious! I'm thinking you could mix different fillings and have a mixed berry crisp. Thank you!

Needed a recipe to use my canned cherry pie filling and found this one. Only thing I added was a pie crust in the bottom of it. Other than that I used butter for the topping and just softened it at room temp. No margarine EVER in baked goods!!!
Super easy to make with just a few ingredients. Cooks with a great presentation!
I put a different twist to my favorite dessert by adding some yellow sliced peaches, oh! It came out fantastic!
Made exactly according to the recipe. Simple, quick and really good. Will definitely make this again.
Made this gluten free, just replaced flour with gluten free rice flour. Turned out great and kids loved it.
Yummy with ice cream. Easy to make. I will add more butter to the topping next time.
Easy and great tasting. I'd make it again.
I will make it again, it was great with vanilla ice cream!
WE LOVE IT! Just finished making it. Very quick to make, made it following your recipe. It was great, thank you!
Easy, fast and pretty nummy.
It was easy, fast, and satisfying. I used dried cherries and rehydrated them instead of canned cherry filling.
We like extra cinnamon and nutmeg in everything but other than that our Grandkids ate it up!! Thanks for an easy and quick recipe.

Wow! This recipe is so good. I did double the topping as many suggested and was glad I did. I also added some almond extract to the cherries, and left out the nutmeg. Will definitely be making this again.
I followed the instructions and this came out delicious. We did add a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top and it was a hit with the husband and the kids.
excellent and easy to make will be making it in future we love cherry pie and Crisps
I didn’t have pecans so I made without nuts and it was delicious next time I might add pecans Will definitely make it again :)!!!
Delicious, one comment said the oats didn’t cook enough, mine seemed to be perfect at the suggested cooking time “ thumbs up”

Way too much shortening. I had exactly enough sour cherries to bake one desert from my young cherry tree. So sorry I picked this one. It was a soggy mess of grease. The topping just vanished into a soup.
Just a delicious desert. I didnt change anything. I dont understand one post...she said to use less ginger...theres no ginger in this recipe. Well whatever im making this once a month at least.
I wouldn’t melt the butter next time, I felt like the crumble could have been crunchier. Overall this was pretty good. The nuts added a nice crunch
I doubled the recipe. Just because I can! :) Also added just a hint of clove... because I like the taste of clove. :)
It was awesome cherry cobbler first time I baked! Great recipes! Thanks!

Loved embellishing this classic recipe! I only had half a can of cherry pie filling so I cut up and tossed in a handful of fresh strawberries, topped that with sprinkling of white chocolate chips and I only had almonds on hand instead of pecans. Oh yeah I reduced the nutmeg and cinnamon to 1/2 tsp each.
I added almond extract and some extra Stevia to the pie filling. I thought it was still a bit tart. Great with vanilla ice cream though!

Fabulous! This will be an ongoing family favorite. I used frozen pie cherries from our harvest last summer. I added a bit of organic sugar & cooked them until the sauce was thickened. I used all organic ingredients & cut the sugar by 1/3. 
I used walnuts & added twice as many. I also increased the cinnamon & nutmeg. 
Fabulous!

I did make some changes as I was testing out ideas for a large party. Put in a 9 x 13 pan.. I used 2 bags of frozen cherries and soaked them in a chocolate wine. Mixed those with 2 cans of cherry pie filling. Subbed almonds for pecans because I had them on hand. Doubled the topping and used cold butter instead of melted. Everyone who tried it in the tasting room gave it 2 thumbs up so will be making a lot of it in the future for a party! Adding ice cream or whipped cream helps to balance it out in a good way!
Awfull!!! Doughy topping, did not taste sweet and actually hurt my teeth. There is just something off with this recipe!!!
Love it! Follow the recipe as written. We have it every Christmas and Thanksgiving. Thank you for a great recipe!
Great
I will cook it longer

I made this dessert for a "pre" Thanksgiving luncheon at work. My colleagues really enjoyed it and several asked for the recipe. It is very easy to make with readily available ingredients. I will definitely be making it again soon!
This is a very good dessert but please be aware it is NOT vegan. Brown sugar is not considered vegan. It is processed with bone char.

I made this this per the recipe but with the addition of some fresh pineapple to the cherry pie filling since it sounded good and also subbing out the oats for an equal amount of granola since I didn’t have plain oats. I loved my addition and substitution! One thing I would change for future use would be to decrease the amount of margarine (I used butter) called for as it made it a bit too wet for the topping. It’s pretty heavily spiced tasting even though it didn’t seem to use much spice. That might have been due to my quality of cinammon I used.
It was really good. I did add some butter on top of the crumble and baked it about 5-10 minutes longer. Served with whipped cream.

Instead of pie filling, I warmed up some frozen mixed berries (blackberries, blueberries, raspberries, and strawberries) in a saucepan and made a compote with some brown sugar. I also used almonds instead of walnuts on top. Came out lovely!!

I had about half a can of cherry pie filling left over after making crepes, so I halved the recipe, only used a dash of nutmeg, and it was delicious! Served with ice cream the night I made it, it was the perfect size for me husband and me, with a little leftover for a midnight snack! Next time, I may toast the topping (similar to what I do with bread crumbs to give them a little extra crunch), but the recipe really is fantastic as-is!
no changes. It disappeared quickly!
BOOT! One can of pie filling did absolutely nothing for such a large dish. I just dumped the can in and am livid. What a waste!!! Guess Ill have to find my way around this.

Used freshly pitted and chopped cherries instead of canned. Mixed a little sugar and flour in the cherries. Added pinches of allspice, ginger, cardamom, & nutmeg to the crumble topping mixture. Served with a dolllop of sour cream. So delicious. I would definitely make this again.

This recipe is just too sweet for me. My teeth hurt after trying 1 small dish of it; it was so sweet even with ice cream that I won't be eating any more of it. Sorry - maybe 1/3 cup of brown sugar would be plenty --??
I made it but it was "runny". The directions wrote nothing about draining the cherries. As a consequence it was to wet. Delicious all the same. But next time I'm draining the can.
I used all non-sugar and sugar substitutes as well as no Pecans for this recipe! It turned out pretty good!
This was so Delicious. I used frozen organic dark sweet cherries instead of pie filling, as we grew up using fresh fruit and these frozen cherries are the best!!
This was better than any other crisp I have made. I loved the nutmeg. Will make again!

I did the butter oats, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg (reduced by 1/2), almonds and butter (cold) in food processor made the process really easy. I was surprised I am really a cherry crisp fan, think use this instead of making pies. Was great with ice cream and whipped cream.
used peach filling instead of cherry

I had a pie crust that I needed to use so I made this recipe using the crust for the bottom and followed the rest of the recipe as written. It was a big mistake on my part using the crust, but the rest of the ingredients were tasty and I will probably make it again following directions.

So easy and oh so good! I had guys coming over to watch a game and thought a sweet snack would be a good idea...It was! I always read other reviews for ideas and I did go with more of the crunchy stuff, using half for a bottom, the other half on top. Perfect! I'm going to go with apple the next time.

This was exceptionally easy to make. Great for a quick, weeknight desert. With that being said, I do have to agree with everyone else that this recipe calls for a bit too much nutmeg. I will probably make this again, but with less.
Made my own pie filling and did what the recipe said (without the pecans) and it is baking right as I'm typing this but it looks and smells so good. I can't wait to eat it

Wow wow wow!!! Totally delish. The only thing I changed was I used fresh tart cherries because we received them in our CSA box this week. After pitting them, I had 4 cups. I added sugar and flour to the cherries and heated it up. I didn't double the crumble. I would make this again.
It was ok,if I make it again I will add more cherries

Delicious. Basic ingredients. Was craving a sweet at 8:00 pm.
Whipped this out and filled the urge. Excellent tasting and 
changed nothing.

I made this exactly as posted, and it was grand. Definitely does not need any extra topping. Actually made two of them. One with just the cherries and one with the cherries and some frozen blueberries that I had mixed up with a bit of sugar. I added a little of the blueberry mixture to the canned cherries just for a slight change of flavor (hubby loves bluberries). Both were wonderful. Took the original one to my card playing group and have members clamoring for the recipe. Thanks for this one. Will be making it again.
Full disclosure - I didn't make this exactly as written. Instead I chose to put unsweetened applesauce as the base and it was DELICIOUS. I also added a pinch of cloves which worked nicely.
I did use butter rather than margarine and it was wonderful. I will make it often.
The topping needs sugar. Not sweet enough. Too much nutmeg and cinnamon. The topping was mushy--not crunchy.

We enjoyed this very much. I would leave out the nutmeg next time for cherry and add a bit of almond flavor..
Going to try peach filling next/.
Most definitely will make it agian.. I didn't add nutmeg not a big fan of nutmeg.. was good without it.

I made this on the spur of the moment. I had used part of a can of cherry pie filling, and I had to finish it, so I used this recipe and added one apple diced to fill in. Was having some friends in for dessert. It was easy to make and every one liked it
